newsitem.title: USA: Equitable sees oper costs savings in 2nd half.
newsitem.headline: Equitable sees oper costs savings in 2nd half.

text.p: Equitable Cos said Thursday it expects fixed operating cost savings of $20 million in the second half of the year and $40-to-$50 million on an annualized basis beginning in 1998.
The company said these expected savings are a result of steps it carried out during the second quarter designed to reduce expenses.
During the second quarter, however, these measures reduced after-tax net earnings by $23.7 million in the form of restructuring charges.
The company reported fulling diluted earnings per share for the quarter of $0.74 compared to $0.60 for the same period a year ago. Revenues were $2.6 billion compared to $2.18 billion.

Operating earnings of $1.12 per share fully diluted compared to $0.54 exclude after-tax investment gains of $3.7 million and after-tax restructuring charges of $24.2 million, primarily related to its recent cost reduction program.
